title: ICE when compiling the `compact` crate

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
ICE when compiling the `compact` crate v0.2.13


```
error: internal compiler error: librustc/traits/specialize/mod.rs:104: When translating substitutions for specialization, the expected specialization failed to hold

thread 'main' panicked at 'Box<Any>', librustc_errors/lib.rs:600:9

#0 [mir_built] processing `<compact_dict::CompactDict<K, V, A> as compact::Compact>::decompact`

#4 [borrowck] processing `<compact_dict::CompactDict<K, V, A> as compact::Compact>::decompact`

error: aborting due to previous error


note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.32.0-nightly (8b096314a 2018-11-02) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=3 -C codegen-units=4 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden
```
